intro: Robiquetia hamata, commonly known as the hairy sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Robiquetia hamata is often found in open grasslands and along coastal dunes.
